H0.text: Substance is a sample of matter that has the same physical and chemical properties throughout itself.

H1.text: Antimatter is a sample of matter that has the same physical and chemical properties throughout itself.

H2.text: Essence is a sample of matter that has the same physical and chemical properties throughout itself.

H3.text: Molecule is a sample of matter that has the same physical and chemical properties throughout itself.

A4.text: Chemical substance, a material with a definite chemical composition

A5.text: Matter, anything that has mass and takes up space

A6.text: In chemistry, substance is a unique form of matter with constant chemical composition and characteristic properties.

A7.text: Many minerals, however, mutually dissolve into solid solutions, such that a single rock is a uniform substance despite being a mixture in stoichiometric terms.
